alert.note: Alert for Boyd; Brown; Eastern Cherry; Holt; Keya Paha; Rock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 30 at 2:37AM CDT until April 01 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with accumulations of 1 to 3 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Portions of north central Nebraska. * WHEN...From Friday morning through late Friday night. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The combination of strong winds and blowing and drifting snow could lead to very difficult travel conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There continues to be some forecast uncertainty with this approaching system. Though the bulk of the heaviest snow is expected to fall to the north over South Dakota, a slight southward shift in the system could bring significant impacts to far northern Nebraska.
info.instruction: Prepare for possible winter storm conditions. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Boyd; Brown; Eastern Cherry; Holt; Keya Paha; Rock
